abstract: The president has approached William Daley, a former commerce secretary and a senior JPMorgan Chase banker, about possibly becoming his new chief of staff.
snippet: The president has approached William Daley, a former commerce secretary and a senior JPMorgan Chase banker, about possibly becoming his new chief of staff.
lead_paragraph: President Obama has approached William Daley, a former commerce secretary and a senior JPMorgan Chase executive, about the possibility of becoming the next White House chief of staff, Michael D. Shear and Jeff Zeleny of The New York Times reported on Tuesday, citing people familiar with the conversation.

headline.main: Obama Talked With JPMorgan Executive About Top Post
